oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Wesley Rose Interviewed by Bob Allen in 1979
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Bob Allen interviewing Wesley Rose. The recording takes place on 08-20-1979.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Wesley Rose
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:02) -- Bob Allen explains his purpose of interviewing Wesley Rose. Bob Allen is writing an article about the publishing industry in Nashville, TN. (0:35) -- Bob Allen asks about the origins of Wesley Rose's company (Acuff/Rose). Wesley Rose first came to Nashville in 1945. (0:57) -- Bob Allen asks Wesley Rose about the origins of the company, apparently started with just a handshake. (1:25) -- Wesley Rose describes becoming a part of Acuff/Rose in 1950. (1:52) -- Wesley Rose mentions forming another publishing company named Fred Rose Music. (3:03) -- Wesley Rose describes Fred Rose wanting someone to be a part of the company who just understood business. (3:32) -- "I didn't know anything about the music business, at all." - Wesley Rose about first joining Acuff/Rose. (4:20) -- "I hadn't realized I was learning something while in the studio, I thought I was just listening." - Wesley Rose. (4:51) -- Interview continues, Bob Allen asks about music publishing competition in Nashville when Acuff/Rose began. (6:49) -- Wesley Rose speaks about the advantages of being the only publishing company in Nashville in the late 1940's. (7:38) -- Bob Allen asks about how Acuff/Rose first got songs to pop artists. (7:56) -- Wesley Rose speaks about his relationship with Mitch Miller. (9:42) -- Bob Allen asks Wesley Rose about the initial earnings of Acuff/Rose. (10:32) -- Bob Allen asks about the first hits of Acuff/Rose. (11:48) -- Wesley Rose speaks about Fred Rose's relationship with Gene Autry. (12:50) -- Bob Allen asks Wesley Rose about Fred Rose's business acumen. (14:06) -- Wesley Rose speaks about Fred Rose hiring an accountant for Acuff/Rose's expenses. (16:25) -- Bob Allen asks about Wesley Rose's life before coming to Nashville in 1945. (17:33) -- Wesley Rose describes the relationship between songwriters and Fred Rose. Wesley also mentions the great respect everyone had for Roy Acuff. (19:11) -- Wesley Rose shares his advice on professional songwriting. Wesley goes on to describe the teamwork between a writer and publishing company. (21:44) -- Bob Allen asks Wesley Rose about Jack Stapp working for Acuff/Rose. (22:12) -- Bob Allen asks Wesley Rose about music row. (22:56) -- Wesley Rose speaks about the benefits of music row. (23:17) -- Wesley Rose mentions Owen Bradley & Castle Studios. Wesley describes how Owen would make artists feel welcome in a studio. (24:30) -- Wesley Rose speaks about pop/country crossovers. (26:00) -- Wesley Rose speaks about Acuff/Rose's promotion of Roy Orbison. (26:55) -- Wesley Rose speaks on Elvis Presley being played on country radio stations instead of pop/rock stations. (29:30) -- Wesley Rose speaks about the creation of the CMA (Country Music Association). (30:52) -- Bob Allen asks Wesley Rose about publishing companies Acuff/Rose has recently acquired. (32:22) -- Bob Allen asks Wesley Rose about the art of keeping songs in a certain catalog alive (Hank Williams). (33:40) -- Wesley Rose speaks about becoming a "catalog company." (36:05) -- Bob Allen asks about the value of the Hank Williams catalog.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Rose, Wesley;
